According to former Meta employees and documents filed to the U.S.  Department of Labor, many of the layoffs affected staffers in client  support, customer experience and communities.

As part of the company’s two rounds of layoffs, equaling roughly 21,000  job cuts, Meta gutted wide swaths of its customer service operation,  leaving influencers and businesses with nobody to contact about their  accounts.

Meta’s two rounds of layoffs are affecting the company’s already  poor customer service for users, influencers, communities and  businesses.
Meta ended a customer-support feature in January for privileged users who manage popular Facebook communities and groups.

According to former Meta employees and documents filed to the U.S.  Department of Labor, many of the layoffs affected staffers in client  support, customer experience and communities.

As part of the company’s two rounds of layoffs, equaling roughly 21,000  job cuts, Meta gutted wide swaths of its customer service operation,  leaving influencers and businesses with nobody to contact about their  accounts.

Meta’s two rounds of layoffs are affecting the company’s already  poor customer service for users, influencers, communities and  businesses.
Meta ended a customer-support feature in January for privileged users who manage popular Facebook communities and groups.
